comments:
I20030330

This may be a dup of bug 44168 or bug 55844, but they seem not quite the same
and they are marked as fixed... so here I go:

I get a number of the following exception (about 10 or more) every time I fire
up my run-time workbench in the debugger. 
- I am using the PDE plug-in container.
- The workspace is a couple of weeks old, but has been continuously run with all
I builds.
- The problem does not show up with a fresh workspace.

Referring to bug 55844 comment 4, I might be wrong using an old workspace...

--

Although I could/will guard against the NPEs, it seems that a plug-in project 
in your workspace has no plug-in id.
What projects are in your workspace?  Also, check the "Plug-ins" View to see 
if any of them has no label, and report back with your findings.

Hm, my workspace consists of one project from cvs (jdt-ui, not up to date) and a
number of test projects that are not plug-in projects.

Created an attachment (id=9256)
plug-ins view

the first half of my plug-ins view - some features seem to lack a name.

the nameless fragments are org.eclipse.core.runtime.compatibility, update, and
some other.

Tom, please go to the main PDE preference page,  select the option to show 
plug-ins using "id", then look again at your Plug-ins View and see if there 
are any entries at all that does not have an id at all.

Also, since the problem is with workspace plug-in, watch for the plug-ins that 
have a project icon.

We can't tell very much by the screen shot you attached, since the plug-ins 
are all showing using full names.

Interesting: when I switched to IDs with the plug-ins view open, I got the NPE
below. Examining the view, there was no entry with no ID at all; however, the
org.eclipse.jdt.ui plug-in just showed as a leaf node, while all other items in
the view have child nodes (plugin.xml etc.).

The leaf node is what you are supposed to see, since we don't want to 
replicate what Navigator/Package Explorer show.  The Plug-ins view shows you 
the full content of external plug-ins only, since you can't see that info 
anywhere else.

As for the NPE for which this bug report was open, I believe changes made in 
the past week should take care of it (i.e. as of today's I-build).

We will keep the bug report open to address the new, yet unrelated, NPE that 
you just encountered.  Thanks Tom.
NPE in comment #6 is fixed in the new editor.
